meanings.definition: territories: areas of land under the jurisdiction of a particular government or ruler
meanings.sent1: The neighboring countries disputed the ownership of the bordering territs.
meanings.sent2: The explorers mapped out the uncharted territs to expand their knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game pretending to be rulers of imaginary territs.
meanings.sent4: The wildlife sanctuary expanded its territs to protect more endangered species.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins lay hidden within the unexplored territs of the jungle.

meanings.definition: territorial: relating to a territory or territories
meanings.sent1: The territorial disputes between the neighboring countries escalated quickly.
meanings.sent2: The territorial boundaries were clearly marked on the map.
meanings.sent3: The territorial cat hissed at the intruding dog in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The territorial instincts of the lioness protected her cubs from danger.
meanings.sent5: The territorial behavior of the birds was fascinating to observe in the park.

meanings.definition: territorialize: to establish territorial boundaries or control over an area
meanings.sent1: The settlers began to territorialize the newly discovered land.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to territorialize the disputed region for better governance.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to territorialize their play area with imaginary lines.
meanings.sent4: The company sought to territorialize the market by launching a new advertising campaign.
meanings.sent5: The artist aimed to territorialize the art scene with their unique style.
